This mod is deprecated as [Hullcam VDS](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/46365-1-0-2-Hullcam-VDS-added-First-Person-EVA-DDS-textures-Updated-29-Apr) has it already implemented now. A re-code with better maneuvering abilities is planned though.

Continuing [FlaccidUnicorn's FirstPersonEVA](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/73799-0-23-FirstPersonEVA)

[![5NytDpq.png](http://i.imgur.com/5NytDpq.png)](http://imgur.com/jnpYWiV)

I've compiled FlaccidUnicorn's FirstPersonEVA mod for KSP 0.90, using the [Hullcam VDS 0.90 update](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/46365-0-90-Hullcam-VDS-0-90-update-Updated-16-Dec).

FirstPersonEVA is released under the LGPLv3, Hullcam VDS under the GPL. I've included both in the binary package, including the source code for FirstPersonEVA (HullCam.dll is distributed unmodified).

Source Code: [https://github.com/flurreh/FirstPersonEVA](https://github.com/flurreh/FirstPersonEVA)

Binary Releases: [https://github.com/flurreh/FirstPersonEVA/releases](https://github.com/flurreh/FirstPersonEVA/releases)

Usage

To enable/disable the EVA camera, press "-" or "=" on your keyboard or choose "Activate Camera"/"Deactivate Camera" from the Kerbal right-click menu.

This mod adds a camera inside the Kerbal's EVA helmet. Sometimes it bugs out while using in an environment with gravity (i.e. on Kerbin), I'll look into that later tho.

Installation

Just download the binary (.tar.gz) archive and move the "FirstPersonEVA" folder inside into your KSP/GameData directory.

What's coming next?

To be honest - I don't know. I'll keep it update for future KSP versions (as long as it will still be needed) and I'll probably enhance it a bit. (i.e. better textures)

However, I'll fix bugs which I (or you) encounter, as long as they're not related to KSP itself or the Unity engine. Please report issues either [here](https://github.com/flurreh/FirstPersonEVA/issues/new) (I favor this) or as PM here on the forum. Additionally, you might send me a [PM](http://www.reddit.com/message/compose/?to=flurreeh) on reddit, although it's not sure whether or not I'll see it, so don't wonder when I don't reply or when I take some time to do so.
